The movie is divided into two parts: “Early Love” and “Last Love.” While giving audiences the background information of the complicated, poignant life of the author, it also examines the ideology-based conflicts and the value system held in that age. Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, but still it was good. One things that I liked about that was how Sean did other things other than dancing in the movie, because sometimes people only see dancers as dancers but in this movie you get to see who he really is, his cut up life, like his girlfriend and all the deaths of his family

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat.
